name: Jowar Roti
history: Jowar Roti, also known as 'Jolada Rotti' in Karnataka, is a traditional Indian flatbread popular in various parts of the country. It is particularly a staple in regions where jowar (sorghum) is a predominant crop.
description: Jowar Roti is an unleavened Indian flatbread made from jowar flour, which is ground from sorghum grains. It's gluten-free and known for its rich nutritional profile. Jowar Roti has a soft texture and mild, nutty flavor.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix jowar flour with a pinch of salt (optional). Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft dough.

instructions.title: Shape and Cook the Rotis
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Flatten each ball and roll it out into a round shape on a flat surface using your hands. Cook each roti on a hot griddle until it develops brown spots on both sides.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot Jowar Rotis with a curry, dal, or chutney of your choice.

tips: The dough should be soft to make the rolling easier.
Cooking on medium heat ensures even cooking and prevents the rotis from getting hard.
variations: Add herbs or spices like cumin seeds or chopped cilantro to the dough for extra flavor.
Make stuffed rotis with vegetables or lentil fillings for a more nutritious meal.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh, as they tend to harden over time.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a griddle if necessary.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until soft and warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional thali with accompaniments like pickles and yogurt.
Garnish with fresh herbs for an appealing presentation.
